title: How to Create a Makeshift PSP Case

steps.headline: Take the old shirt and put your PSP on it.
Use the marker and draw an oval a few inches larger than the PSP around it.
Remove the PSP from the shirt and use the scissors to cut through the shirt and into the oval.
Cut the shape of the oval out of the ENTIRE shirt (both sides, front and back).
Take both of the ovals which you just cut out and sew them together(with the oval drawing you made facing outward)almost all the way, but leave about 1/4 of the ovals not stitched together.
Now you need to sew a button to the remaining flap (of your choice), and cut a hole on the other flap to make a button hole.
Now flip the pouch inside out to conceal the oval drawing.
Now fit your PSP inside and button it to see if it fits.
It it does, CONGRATULATIONS!!!
steps.description: You just made a PSP pouch. If not, you'll have to repeat the whole process over again until you get a good fit.

text: Take the old shirt and put your PSP on it.  Use the marker and draw an oval a few inches larger than the PSP around it.  Remove the PSP from the shirt and use the scissors to cut through the shirt and into the oval.  Cut the shape of the oval out of the ENTIRE shirt (both sides, front and back).  Take both of the ovals which you just cut out and sew them together(with the oval drawing you made facing outward)almost all the way, but leave about 1/4 of the ovals not stitched together.  Now you need to sew a button to the remaining flap (of your choice), and cut a hole on the other flap to make a button hole.  Now flip the pouch inside out to conceal the oval drawing.  Now fit your PSP inside and button it to see if it fits.  It it does, CONGRATULATIONS!!! You just made a PSP pouch. If not, you'll have to repeat the whole process over again until you get a good fit.
